summary.intent: Change the badge label for GitHub Copilot instruction files from 'AGENTS.md' to 'Copilot instructions' in the context tree view.
summary.outcome: Fixed both the file type classification (plain .md files in .github/instructions/ now correctly classified as 'copilot') and the badge label ('Copilot instructions'). All 1321 tests pass, lint clean, and changes committed.

repo: File type classification lives in src/shared/file-system/context-files-summarizer.ts in getContextFileType()
Badge labels for file types are rendered in frontend/src/components/ContextTreeView.tsx
The IContextFile interface has a 'type' field that drives badge display throughout the UI
Working tree had pre-existing unrelated changes before this task began

code.finding: getContextFileType() previously only matched *.instructions.md files in .github/instructions/ as 'copilot'; plain .md files like code-style.md fell through to the default 'agents' type. Fixed by classifying all .md files in that directory as 'copilot'.
Badge label for copilot file type was 'Copilot', changed to 'Copilot instructions'.

workflow: Used 'rtk' prefix for git and bun commands (likely a wrapper/alias in this environment)
Staged only the two modified files explicitly rather than 'git add .' to avoid committing pre-existing unrelated changes

friction: fileType/type property tracing required many grep iterations across multiple files before locating the source in context-files-summarizer.ts
The 'rtk' command wrapper was used without explanation, requiring implicit knowledge of the environment
open_items: Pre-existing modified/untracked files in the working tree were not committed and may need attention
No test cases exist for .github/instructions/ plain .md file classification (only 1321 existing tests passed, none appear to cover this specific new path)
